caption: My BMX bike and some of my gear
Lots of essentials here. Wet Ones. Head lamp. Sun Hat. Ear plugs. Eye shade, etc.
Don't forget your ticket!
$20 child's size tent did the trick beautifully.  I could fit in it if I laid diagonally across it.
I built the world's simplest shade structure.  It survived until Saturday night when the wind snapped the PVC pipe clear through.
Food for a week in the desert. Mostly Clif Bars, oatmeal, and beef jerky.
Interior of the 1976 Winnebago Tasca RV I rode out in.
We ran out of gas just a few hundred yards from a gas station on our first tank.  Not a great sign.
The Sun rises Monday morning at the entrance gate.  Made for some beautiful views and lots of happy burners.
Line at the entrance gate about 6am Monday.
Mural outside of center camp
Me in my solarphobic dress out on the open playa near a random art oasis with couches and palm trees.

The Man with his Tangled Bank base piece.  A lot of work to exist for a week then burn to the ground, huh?
Great art car
One of the statues from 2007 Hope and Fear. These are amazing. She's made mostly of enormous chains.
